title: Drawing, "Design for Embroidery of a man's waistcoat", 1780–90
medium:
Pen, blue ink, watercolor, gouache, graphite
Support: laid paper
inscribed: Inscription (in French): la baguette en paillete et une cordon de cannetille sourde d'or, tout ce que est blance en foeuille et en fleurs passe argant, les paillons lisiere en canetille sourde argent et en diamantbouchete au millieu, l'houpe passe or et argent. ranslation: outline in sequins and a cord of matte coiled gold wire, all that is white in leaves and flowers in flat silver, the colored and shaped spangles edged with matte silver wire and also the faceted "diamond" in themiddle, the tufts in faded gold and silver.
description: Lower left section of a waistcoat.  Below the pocket a fan-shaped spray of naturalistic flowers, flanked by smaller sprays of imaginative types.  A repeat flower motif along the border.  Design on pocket suggested in outline.  Four lines of inscription, above.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Embroidery of a man's waistcoat", 1780–90.
1780–90. Pen, blue ink, watercolor, gouache, graphite
Support: laid paper. Gift of Jacob H. Schiff. 1906-21-241.
